thread.title: WATCH: Handscomb misses numerous tough opportunities with the gloves | Cricket | Sporting News
thread.title_full: WATCH: Handscomb misses numerous tough opportunities with the gloves | Cricket | Sporting News

author: Michael Di Lonardo
title: WATCH: Handscomb misses numerous tough opportunities with the gloves | Cricket | Sporting News
text:
January 29, 2017 7:24pm EST January 29, 2017 7:24pm EST Would Matty Wade have got there? Michael Di Lonardo 
Published on Jan. 29, 2017 
Jan. 29, 2017 
Stand-in captain Matthew Wade missed out on the first ODI against New Zealand after waking up with back spasms, giving Peter Handscomb the chance to put on the gloves. 
MORE: Wade back injury sees Finch captain, Handscomb to keep | Starc targeting Guptill and Williamson 
Australia's new favourite batsmen took on the keeping duties previously for the Melbourne Stars and Victoria, but opted to give them up to focus purely on his batting. 
It seems as though Handscomb has directed his complete attention to the bat, leaving his keeping skills in the closet. 
The 25-year-old let three close, yet tough, opportunities slip through the gloves off all-rounder Travis Head's challenging deliveries. 
To be fair, one didn't end up being an edge and went for four byes. 
What would have happened if Wade was behind the stumps?
